intro: Eberlanzia micrantha, commonly known as the small-fruited eberlanzia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. Eberlanzia micrantha is often found in humid, shaded environments within lowland rainforests.
